items.q: Two people in their thirties are sitting directly ____________________ (on top of / in front of) the window.
They whisper ____________________ (into / onto) each other's ears as if they're keeping secrets from the rest of the world.
____________________ (Across / Next to) them, a middle-aged man is sitting alone.
The dance floor is ____________________ (inside / to the right of) the dining area, and it is filled with people, young and old.
Dressed completely in black, a man is dancing while staring ____________________ (at / on) his feet.
I take food orders and watch the people____________________ (in / on) the dance floor.
____________________ (Above / To the right of) the kitchen door sits a young couple.
The woman is wearing an engagement ring ____________________ (on / at) her finger.
After dinner, the couple takes a walk ____________________ (along / inside) the beach.
They see a shooting star streak ____________________ (near / across) the sky.
They both noticed the ____________________ (bad / fishy) smell coming from the bag.
She was a beautiful child, with ____________________ (chocolate / brown) eyes and a bright smile.
"What do you think you are doing?" he ____________________ (asked / barked).
The spicy sauce ____________________ (stung / hurt) her lips.
They liked to sit and watch the butterflies ____________________ (move / skip) from flower to flower.
My grandmother's kitchen was always full of ____________________ (good / delicious) smells.
The flames of the fire ____________________ (danced / rose) above the trees.
The man had ____________________ (red / lobster)-colored skin after a day at the beach.
The ____________________ (thunderous / loud) sound of the waves kept her awake all night.
The pony's hair felt ____________________ (silky / soft) to touch.
Our book club ____________________ at a member's home on the first Friday of every month.
In a(n) ____________________ world, everyone would have enough to eat.
Katrina was ____________________ waiting to get the test results back from her doctor.
She made it to the end of the 20-mile race and then ____________________ on the ground in exhaustion.
Next, we're ____________________ North Carolina— we have family there to visit.
I loved his ____________________ attitude; nothing ever seemed to make him angry.
Sam made the toast, "To a great new year!" and everyone ____________________ their glasses together.
Please speak loudly. When you ____________________ I cannot hear you.
My teacher recommends that we just____________________ the chapter the night before an exam, instead of reading it word for word.
He put a fat worm—one of the fish's favorite foods—on the ____________________.
Hiroko went to the new bookstore from the corner of 7 th Avenue and Bond Street after work yesterday. a. to b. from c. after
Our meeting will be in the conference room next the lunchroom at 3:00. a. in b. next c. at
The new Indian restaurant that is opening on Friday is just past the big shopping complex in Market Street. a. on b. past c. in
Just put the turkey across the table next to the mashed potatoes. a. across b. next c. to
Anya is sitting across to Joe on the sofa, and they are talking about world politics. a. across to b. on c. about
The police quickly ran over the building between the bank and the library, hoping to surprise the thief as he came out of the bank. a. over b. between c. out of
Uruguay is a small country under South America, located between Argentina and Brazil, and not far from Paraguay. a. under b. between c. far from
The president sat next to the important dignitary by Italy and discussed affairs of the state. a. next to b. by c. of
released _____ jail
_____ you need to do is
_____ to be here
proceed _____ the next step
to stand _____
to have a fear _____ something
to jot _____ names
_____ clockwork
_____ potatoes
to stay _____ trouble
She saw a huge black bear standing next of her car. ____________________
Maple Road is at Oak Street and Second Avenue. ____________________
Sarah sat on the steps on the library, waiting. ____________________
The boy hid above the blanket on his bed. ____________________
I put your keys in the bottom drawer of the desk. ____________________
Diabetes can lead to serious health problems. ____________________
The two candidates' ideas about health care reform differ in three key areas. ____________________
When you compare the men’s and women’s athletic programs in colleges throughout the U.S., obvious disparities are evident. ____________________
Unsustainable development has destroyed many powerful cultures throughout history. ____________________
I group my enemies into three main categories: obvious villains, false friends, and myself. ____________________
If more people saw a doctor regularly as a preventative measure, we would be a healthier society. ____________________
While it seems that the two should be almost exactly alike, there are actually some notable differences between The Hunger Games book and movie. ____________________
Changes in homeland security have significantly affected the ability of international students to attend school in the U.S. ____________________
The day I emigrated from my country to the U.S. was the most difficult day of my life. ____________________
One should consider buying a Speedster 8000 for its performance, style, and comfort. ____________________
TOPIC: Global Warming HOOK: Within ten years, many people in the world will not have water to drink.
TOPIC: The Real Cost of Plastic Bottles HOOK: Jim gazed out at the ocean. The surface was blanketed with plastic bottles as far as he could see.
TOPIC: The Flu Virus HOOK: Every year there is some new virus, and this year will be no different.
TOPIC: Health Care HOOK: Kelly had a good job and a nice home, until she developed cancer. Now she's living in a homeless shelter.
TOPIC: Protecting Our Children from Internet Dangers HOOK: Most children are not suspicious of people they meet online.
Describe your ideal home. Where is it, and what does it look like? Who lives there with you? Use connecting transitional words and expressions.
